verses.verse: Know <WG50> you not, brothers, <WG80> (for I speak <WG2980> to them that know <WG1097> the law, <WG3551>) how that the law <WG3551> has dominion <WG2961> over a man <WG444> as long <WG5550> as he lives? <WG2198>

For the woman <WG1135> which has <WG5220> an husband <WG5220> is bound <WG1210> by the law <WG3551> to her husband <WG435> so long as he lives; <WG2198> but if <WG1437> the husband <WG435> be dead, <WG599> she is loosed <WG2673> from the law <WG3551> of her husband. <WG435>

So <WG686> then <WG686> if, <WG1437> while her husband <WG435> lives, <WG2198> she be married <WG1096> to another <WG2087> man, <WG435> she shall be called <WG5537> an adulteress: <WG3428> but if <WG1437> her husband <WG435> be dead, <WG599> she is free <WG1658> from that law; <WG3551> so that she is no <WG3361> adulteress, <WG3428> though she be married <WG1096> to another <WG2087> man. <WG435>

Why, <WG5620> my brothers, <WG80> you also <WG2532> are become <WG2289> dead <WG2289> to the law <WG3551> by the body <WG4983> of Christ; <WG5547> that you should be married <WG1096> to another, <WG2087> even to him who is raised <WG1453> from the dead, <WG3498> that we should bring <WG2592> forth fruit <WG2592> to God. <WG2316>

For when <WG3753> we were in the flesh, <WG4561> the motions <WG3804> of sins, <WG266> which <WG3588> were by the law, <WG3551> did work <WG1754> in our members <WG3196> to bring <WG2592> forth fruit <WG2592> to death. <WG2288>

But now <WG3570> we are delivered <WG2673> from the law, <WG3551> that being dead <WG599> wherein <WG1722> <WG3757> we were held; <WG2722> that we should serve <WG1398> in newness <WG2538> of spirit, <WG4151> and not in the oldness <WG3821> of the letter. <WG1121>

What <WG5101> shall we say <WG2046> then? <WG3767> Is the law <WG3551> sin? <WG266> God <WG3361> <WG1096> forbid. <WG3361> <WG1096> No, <WG235> I had not known <WG1097> sin, <WG266> but by the law: <WG3551> for I had not known <WG1492> lust, <WG1939> except <WG1508> the law <WG3551> had said, <WG3004> You shall not covet. <WG1937>

But sin, <WG266> taking <WG2983> occasion <WG874> by the commandment, <WG1785> worked <WG2716> in me all <WG3956> manner of concupiscence. <WG1939> For without <WG5565> the law <WG3551> sin <WG266> was dead. <WG3498>
For I was alive <WG2198> without <WG5565> the law <WG3551> once: <WG4218> but when the commandment <WG1785> came, <WG2064> sin <WG266> revived, <WG326> and I died. <WG599>
And the commandment, <WG1785> which <WG3588> was ordained to life, <WG2222> I found <WG2147> to be to death. <WG2288>
For sin, <WG266> taking <WG2983> occasion <WG874> by the commandment, <WG1785> deceived <WG1818> me, and by it slew <WG615> me.
Why <WG5620> the law <WG3551> is holy, <WG40> and the commandment <WG1785> holy, <WG40> and just, <WG1342> and good. <WG18>

Was then <WG3767> that which is good <WG18> made <WG1096> death <WG2288> to me? God <WG3361> <WG1096> forbid. <WG3361> <WG1096> But sin, <WG266> that it might appear <WG5316> sin, <WG266> working <WG2716> death <WG2288> in me by that which is good; <WG18> that sin <WG266> by the commandment <WG1785> might become <WG1096> exceeding <WG2596> <WG5236> sinful. <WG268>
For we know <WG1492> that the law <WG3551> is spiritual: <WG4152> but I am <WG1510> carnal, <WG4559> sold <WG4097> under <WG5259> sin. <WG266>
For that which <WG3739> I do <WG2716> I allow <WG1097> not: for what <WG3739> I would, <WG2309> that do <WG4238> I not; but what <WG3739> I hate, <WG3404> that do <WG4160> I.
If <WG1487> then <WG1161> I do <WG4160> that which <WG3739> I would <WG2309> not, I consent <WG4852> to the law <WG3551> that it is good. <WG2570>
Now <WG3570> then <WG1161> it is no <WG3765> more <WG2089> I that do <WG2716> it, but sin <WG266> that dwells <WG3611> in me.

For I know <WG1492> that in me (that is, in my flesh, <WG4561>) dwells <WG3611> no <WG3756> good <WG18> thing: for to will <WG2309> is present <WG3873> with me; but how to perform <WG2716> that which is good <WG2570> I find <WG2147> not.
For the good <WG18> that I would <WG2309> I do <WG4160> not: but the evil <WG2556> which <WG3739> I would <WG2309> not, that I do. <WG4238>
Now <WG1161> if <WG1487> I do <WG4160> that I would <WG2309> not, it is no <WG3765> more <WG2089> I that do <WG2716> it, but sin <WG266> that dwells <WG3611> in me.
I find <WG2147> then <WG686> a law, <WG3551> that, when I would <WG2309> do <WG4160> good, <WG2570> evil <WG2556> is present <WG3873> with me.
For I delight <WG4913> in the law <WG3551> of God <WG2316> after <WG2596> the inward <WG2080> man: <WG444>

But I see <WG991> another <WG2087> law <WG3551> in my members, <WG3196> warring <WG497> against <WG497> the law <WG3551> of my mind, <WG3563> and bringing <WG163> me into captivity <WG163> to the law <WG3551> of sin <WG266> which <WG3588> is in my members. <WG3196>
O wretched <WG5005> man <WG444> that I am! who <WG5101> shall deliver <WG4506> me from the body <WG4983> of this <WG5127> death? <WG2288>

I thank <WG2168> God <WG2316> through <WG1223> Jesus <WG2424> Christ <WG5547> our Lord. <WG2962> So <WG686> then <WG686> with the mind <WG3563> I myself serve <WG1398> the law <WG3551> of God; <WG2316> but with the flesh <WG4561> the law <WG3551> of sin. <WG266>
